frame.name: Take_place_of
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>New</fen> filler occupies a <fen>Role</fen> or serves a <fen>Function</fen> after the <fen>Old</fen> filler ceases to occupy the position. In many cases, the <fen>Role</fen> or <fen>Function</fen> is implicit.
<ex><fex name="new">Gas</fex> can <t>substitute</t> <fex name="deg">entirely</fex> <fex name="old">for petrol</fex>.</ex> <ex>Sometime in the 1880s <fex name="new">gas</fex> <t>replaced</t> <fex name="old">oil</fex> <fex name="fun">for manufacturing fuel</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="tim">Twelve years later</fex>, <fex name="new">oil</fex> <t>replaced</t> <fex name="old">coal</fex> <fex name="rol">as the energy of choice</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="New">Honey</fex> can <t>replace</t> <fex name="Old">sugar</fex> <fex name="Context">in this recipe</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: New
FE.definition:
<def-root>The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
<ex>The traditional thatched roof has often been <t>replaced</t> <fex name="new">by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root>The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
<ex>What gas <t>replaced</t> Hydrogen <fex name="rol">as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn? </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Function
FE.definition:
<def-root>The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
<ex>Oil and gas <t>replaced</t> coal <fex name="fun">in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Old
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
<ex>The electron was discovered and <fex name="old">electricity</fex> <t>replaced</t> gas lamps.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
<ex>When electricity <t>replaced</t> oil <fex name="tim">in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Degree</fen> of replacement is generally only possible when <fen>New</fen> entities replace <fen>Old</fen> entities in multiple contexts.
<ex>In the case of Cyprus, all of the former non-flying terrestrial species were exterminated, and have been <fex name="deg">entirely</fex> <t>replaced</t> by species introduced deliberately or accidentally by man.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). The rapidity of replacement is also indicated as <fen>Manner</fen>.
<ex>On land the angiosperms <fex name="man">rapidly</fex> <t>replaced</t> the gymnosperms as the dominant plants</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Context
FE.definition:
<def-root>The domain in which the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities function.
<ex><fex name="New">Machines</fex> have <t>replaced</t><fex name="Old">men</fex> <fex name="Context">in the work force</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: do duty.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: serve or act as a substitute for

lexUnit.name: succeed.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take over an office, title, etc. from (someone). This LU emaphasizes the time aspect of the Take_place_of acion.
